column4: for a dual boot linux/linux: Where should I set the second mount point? Can they both use the same swap?
no they cant use the same swap, second mount point?

if its 1 hd, then each has its own partition

ok, one hard drive, and windows/ubuntu?
it's linux/linux
on two diff partitions?
yes 1 hard drive currently with swap and ext
ok so you wanna dual boot?
yes, to try out the hardware over time then fully switch to ubuntu
ok, so edit /boot/grub/menu.lst (back it up first) and duplicate your entries for each partition
but look in each linux installs' partition to confirm that the kernel you are booting and all the files it wants w/it are there
basically just compare that files config (the real files it references in it) to the other OS's install and change names where necessary
ok, thanks
it looks more complicated than I though
its very manual but I think if you read the file it is self explanatory
